<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TT.isOSzOS()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TT.isArch64Bit()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Custom address space for ptr32.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-p1:32:32&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Make sure that global data has at least 16 bits of alignment by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// default, so that we can refer to it using LARL.  We don&#39;t have any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// special requirements for stack variables though.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-i1:8:16-i8:8:16&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 64-bit integers are naturally aligned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-i64:64&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 128-bit floats are aligned only to 64 bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-f128:64&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The DataLayout string always holds a vector alignment of 64 bits, see</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// comment in clang/lib/Basic/Targets/SystemZ.h.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-v128:64&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We prefer 16 bits of aligned for all globals; see above.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-a:8:16&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Integer registers are 32 or 64 bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-n32:64&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Ret;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94" lineLink="#af3bdb2a4dc7856d907dd29807c6545e2"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;TargetLoweringObjectFile&gt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/vetargetmachine-cpp/#aa6c97e16d212c4e376476c6a988a6c5e">createTLOF</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/triple">Triple</a> &amp;TT) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TT.isOSzOS())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::make&#95;unique&lt;TargetLoweringObjectFileGOFF&gt;();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: Some times run with -triple s390x-unknown.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In this case, default to ELF unless z/OS specifically provided.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::make&#95;unique&lt;SystemZELFTargetObjectFile&gt;();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103" lineLink="#a906e08cf722c544eeff0ae4295cdc0e9"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/reloc/#af59f6dc86e80aaf56f1afd155eebf568">Reloc::Model</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a63737748f52c9cdcd469b63a01cc454a">getEffectiveRelocModel</a>(std::optional&lt;Reloc::Model&gt; RM) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Static code is suitable for use in a dynamic executable; there is no</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// separate DynamicNoPIC model.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!RM || &#42;RM == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/reloc/#af59f6dc86e80aaf56f1afd155eebf568a455bffdcf9dfc03e4b8f11c6085d0f3e">Reloc::DynamicNoPIC</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/reloc/#af59f6dc86e80aaf56f1afd155eebf568a2102fa713297236bf4339c5f0bf0f39d">Reloc::Static</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;RM;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For SystemZ we define the models as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Small:  BRASL can call any function and will use a stub if necessary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         Locally-binding symbols will always be in range of LARL.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Medium: BRASL can call any function and will use a stub if necessary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         GOT slots and locally-defined text will always be in range</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         of LARL, but other symbols might not be.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Large:  Equivalent to Medium for now.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Kernel: Equivalent to Medium for now.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This means that any PIC module smaller than 4GB meets the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// requirements of Small, so Small seems like the best default there.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All symbols bind locally in a non-PIC module, so the choice is less</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// obvious.  There are two cases:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - When creating an executable, PLTs and copy relocations allow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   us to treat external symbols as part of the executable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Any executable smaller than 4GB meets the requirements of Small,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   so that seems like the best default.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - When creating JIT code, stubs will be in range of BRASL if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   image is less than 4GB in size.  GOT entries will likewise be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   in range of LARL.  However, the JIT environment has no equivalent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   of copy relocs, so locally-binding data symbols might not be in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   the range of LARL.  We need the Medium model in that case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8df">CodeModel::Model</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141" lineLink="#a17556499066b467a823a7768a70c4ab0"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a17556499066b467a823a7768a70c4ab0">getEffectiveSystemZCodeModel</a>(std::optional&lt;CodeModel::Model&gt; CM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/reloc/#af59f6dc86e80aaf56f1afd155eebf568">Reloc::Model</a> RM, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> JIT) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (CM) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (&#42;CM == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8dfa686bcdfaefdfe3f49acbfe6f680bc22d">CodeModel::Tiny</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7f2a3d4dcfee70225988aec53ff1e173">report&#95;fatal&#95;error</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Target does not support the tiny CodeModel&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (&#42;CM == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8dfaa6a2e45ae404e3f797d2d7e9f3a48949">CodeModel::Kernel</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7f2a3d4dcfee70225988aec53ff1e173">report&#95;fatal&#95;error</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Target does not support the kernel CodeModel&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;CM;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (JIT)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RM == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/reloc/#af59f6dc86e80aaf56f1afd155eebf568adc2075e13a68142b26e05ac08bbfc320">Reloc::PIC&#95;</a> ? <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8dfaa2554ef60dc191c6005ba9eecbc9aea0">CodeModel::Small</a> : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8dfa29275c05d0afdbda643f7a0fbad83832">CodeModel::Medium</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8dfaa2554ef60dc191c6005ba9eecbc9aea0">CodeModel::Small</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::string CPU =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlight">      CPUAttr.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/attribute/#adf4d22686e85732b2fef71e3c45531c6">isValid</a>() ? <Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#ab2ca200281996a1a8bc064d21d4aa238">addPass</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad6820b1346e9140b1b40af95c5ec190a">IfConverterID</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-systemztargetmachine-cpp-/systemzpassconfig/#aec37fe0cba0b6b61f6d64e6cbb7a7304"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-systemztargetmachine-cpp-/systemzpassconfig/#aec37fe0cba0b6b61f6d64e6cbb7a7304">SystemZPassConfig::addPreEmitPass</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Do instruction shortening before compare elimination because some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vector instructions will be shortened into opcodes that compare</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// elimination recognizes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#a4c36a5c58e6e55c962d2d9bed0bb3ba7">getOptLevel</a>() != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8ec1bf8d7b792ca9fac56f8514db18d2a6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754">CodeGenOptLevel::None</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#ab2ca200281996a1a8bc064d21d4aa238">addPass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a88853c32c18b68474db3ce534a385c1e">createSystemZShortenInstPass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-systemztargetmachine-cpp-/systemzpassconfig/#ad72edd4fc67f57e6bb8efd1c06065c90">getSystemZTargetMachine</a>()));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We eliminate comparisons here rather than earlier because some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transformations can change the set of available CC values and we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// generally want those transformations to have priority.  This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// especially true in the commonest case where the result of the comparison</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is used by a single in-range branch instruction, since we will then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be able to fuse the compare and the branch instead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For example, two-address NILF can sometimes be converted into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// three-address RISBLG.  NILF produces a CC value that indicates whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the low word is zero, but RISBLG does not modify CC at all.  On the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// other hand, 64-bit ANDs like NILL can sometimes be converted to RISBG.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The CC value produced by NILL isn&#39;t useful for our purposes, but the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// value produced by RISBG can be used for any comparison with zero</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (not just equality).  So there are some transformations that lose</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// CC values (while still being worthwhile) and others that happen to make</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the CC result more useful than it was originally.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Another reason is that we only want to use BRANCH ON COUNT in cases</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// where we know that the count register is not going to be spilled.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Doing it so late makes it more likely that a register will be reused</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// between the comparison and the branch, but it isn&#39;t clear whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// preventing that would be a win or not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#a4c36a5c58e6e55c962d2d9bed0bb3ba7">getOptLevel</a>() != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8ec1bf8d7b792ca9fac56f8514db18d2a6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754">CodeGenOptLevel::None</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#ab2ca200281996a1a8bc064d21d4aa238">addPass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4007a15bc63e3cf035a70d0a0324cfe7">createSystemZElimComparePass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-systemztargetmachine-cpp-/systemzpassconfig/#ad72edd4fc67f57e6bb8efd1c06065c90">getSystemZTargetMachine</a>()));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#ab2ca200281996a1a8bc064d21d4aa238">addPass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1386c7aa34a87794c0ef236de2102991">createSystemZLongBranchPass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-systemztargetmachine-cpp-/systemzpassconfig/#ad72edd4fc67f57e6bb8efd1c06065c90">getSystemZTargetMachine</a>()));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Do final scheduling after all other optimizations, to get an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// optimal input for the decoder (branch relaxation must happen</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// after block placement).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#a4c36a5c58e6e55c962d2d9bed0bb3ba7">getOptLevel</a>() != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8ec1bf8d7b792ca9fac56f8514db18d2a6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754">CodeGenOptLevel::None</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig/#ab2ca200281996a1a8bc064d21d4aa238">addPass</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a51a34bf4ca8119bdeb89ffc48c5d4783">PostMachineSchedulerID</a>);</span></CodeLine>
